title: Ticket #5578: condor_gangliad stopped pulling data from restarted collector
description:
At 07:36:52 this morning the DoIT central manager (condor1.doit.wisc.edu) restarted after an automated upgrade. The condor_gangliad daemon that is responsible for pulling the DoIT cm (GANGLIAD_DOIT) runs on monitor0.chtc.wisc.edu. At the time of the DoIT collector restart it began failing to pull new data, and continued to fail until I restarted the condor_gangliad at around 15:42 PM. You can see the discontinuity here:

http://monitor0.chtc.wisc.edu/grafana/dashboard/db/doit-pool?from=1458726752882&to=1458769952882

Here is the email exchange between myself and Dale Carder, who admins the DOIT central manager: 

Thus spake moate@cs.wisc.edu (moate@cs.wisc.edu) on Wed, Mar 23, 2016 at 01:58:27PM -0500:
> It looks like the DoIT pool central manager is unreachable (just
> HTCondor, the machine is ping-able).  Maintenance?

I did see that it automatically updated from 8.4.4 to 8.4.5 at 07:36:52
this morning.  Otherwise, it seems to be chugging along:

[dwcarder@condor1 ~]$ uptime
 14:26:18 up 47 days,  2:15,  2 users,  load average: 0.42, 0.40, 0.35

[dwcarder@condor1 ~]$ condor_status -total
                     Machines Owner Claimed Unclaimed Matched Preempting

        X86_64/LINUX     2263     0    2174        89       0          0
      X86_64/WINDOWS      629   126       0       503       0          0

               Total     2892   126    2174       592       0          0


Let me know if there are lingering issues.

Dale

-Moate
